remarks: It takes two different points to form a line.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 27-Nov-2019.)
statement:
tglineelsb2.p $e |- B = ( Base ` G ) $.
tglineelsb2.i $e |- I = ( Itv ` G ) $.
tglineelsb2.l $e |- L = ( LineG ` G ) $.
tglineelsb2.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. TarskiG ) $.
tglnne.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. B ) $.
tglnne.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. B ) $.
tglnne.1 $e |- ( ph -> ( X L Y ) e. ran L ) $.
tglnne $p |- ( ph -> X =/= Y ) $.
